instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Inputs -> listing

output: ExternalInterface:Schedule  TSetHea                 !- Name\nTemperature             !- ScheduleType\n20;                      !- Initial value used during warm-up

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text
input: How is the average mass flow rate calculated?
output: The average mass flow rate is weighted by the system fan part-load ratio using the calculated air mass flow rates during the fan on and off periods for the system timestep.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> figure in /UAStudy/EnergyPlus/doc/input-output-reference/media/

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heat Recovery -> text

input: What is the value of Coefficient1 for the fan power ratio curve?

output: It applies the ZoneVentilation:WindandStackOpenArea object to a thermal zone or space in the building.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Performance Curves -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Performance Curves -> text
input: What is the purpose of 'Field: Coefficient5 C5'?
output: The required numeric constant coefficient C5 in the equation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text

output: This alpha field contains the identifying name for the Steam Boiler.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text

output: A value of 1 indicates dehumidification mode 1 is active.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text

output: Additional inputs are needed for basin heater parameters water pump power and water source.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: What change occurred in Version 8.0 regarding this object?
output: As of Version 8.0 this object replaces three separate objects that were available prior to version 8.0 of EnergyPlus.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Humidifiers and Dehumidifiers -> text
input: What does a schedule value greater than 0 indicate?
output: A schedule value greater than 0 indicates that the unit can operate during the time period.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \textbf/ -> text
input: What temperatures can the setpoint schedule refer to?
output: The temperature denoted in the setpoint schedule can refer to one of seven different temperatures: the zone mean air temperature the zone mean radiant temperature the zone operative temperature the outdoor dry-bulb temperature the outdoor wet-bulb temperature the radiant surface inside face temperature or the radiant surface interior temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Solar Collectors -> text
input: What can multiple different SolarCollector:FlatPlate:PhotovoltaicThermal objects reference?
output: Multiple different SolarCollector:FlatPlate:PhotovoltaicThermal objects can reference the same object that provides performance details.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What does the 'Mode 0 System Third Fuel Consumption Lookup Table Name' field specify?
output: It specifies the name of a Table:Lookup object that describes third fuel consumption for Mode 0 as a function of six independent variables.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What is Heating Coil Electric Consumption?
output: Heating Coil electric consumption after the efficiency of the coil has been taken into account in Joules for the timestep reported.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Electric Load Center-Generator Specifications -> text
input: What values should the Fraction of Eddy Current Losses field have and what is the default?
output: This numeric field should have a value between 0.0 and 1.0. The default is 0.1.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> equation
input: What is the equation relating various cooling energies when the economizer is not active?
output: Zone Ideal Loads Supply Air Total Cooling Energy + Zone Ideal Loads Heat Recovery Total Cooling Energy = Zone Ideal Loads Zone Total Cooling Energy + Zone Ideal Loads Outdoor Air Total Cooling Energy.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Simulation Parameters -> table row: PerfLog Oscillation Columns
input: What are the values for Run 2 in the 'PerfLog Oscillation Columns' table?
output: For Run 2 the values are: FALSE ScriptF MODE01 7.87 2.67 6.87 65 104.37.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group System Availability Managers -> text
input: What is the hybrid ventilation control HVAC system operation elapsed time?
output: This output is the HVAC system operation elapsed time in the units of minutes since the HVAC system starts.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Room Air Models -> text
input: What is the purpose of the Field: Upper Heat Rate Bound?
output: The Field: Upper Heat Rate Bound is used to enter the upper bound on heat rate values. It is required for the interpolation modes based on load. Both heating and cooling loads are entered as positive numbers (in watts).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What is the gross rated total cooling capacity used for?
output: The gross rated total cooling capacity is used to determine a capacity scaling factor as compared to the Reference Unit capacity at the nominal speed level.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group System Availability Managers -> text

output: The scheduled availability manager has one output variable.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What does the output variable 'Cooling Coil Condensate Volume' represent?
output: The output variable is the total water condensate volume from the cooling coil in m³ over the timestep being reported.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> text

input: What is the control sensor 1 weight?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> table row: Value of opening factor multiplier for different venting conditions

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Humidifiers and Dehumidifiers -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: IDD Conventions -> listing
input: What must be included even if a field is optional in the IDD?
output: ! NOTE: Even though a field may be optional a comma representing that field ! must be included (unless it is the last field in the object). Since the ! entire input is 'field-oriented' and not 'keyword-oriented' the EnergyPlus ! Input Processor must have some representation (even if blank) for each ! field.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: CoolingTower:SingleSpeed -> text
input: How is the cooling tower modeled?

Since this is a passive device the actual cooling capacity depends on water temperatures and flow rates. However this field is used to describe the chilled water tank's nominal cooling capacity for supervisory control where plant operation schemes require a cooling capacity to model how equipment is dispatched.

output: They are computed from a heat balance on the frame/divider that includes solar radiation long-wave radiation convection and conduction.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Solar Collectors -> text
input: What does the 'Generator PVT Fluid Mass Flow Rate [kg/s]' report?
output: This report is the mass flow rate of the working fluid through the PVT collector. This is the overall mass flow rate portions of the flow may be internally bypassed around the collector itself for control modulation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Controllers -> text
input: What happens in a coil with a Normal action controller when more heating or cooling is requested?
output: In a coil with a Normal action controller the mass flow rate through the coil is increased when more heating or cooling is requested.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Pumps -> text

input: How does the Site:HeightVariation object interact with the Site:WeatherStation object?
output: The coefficients set by the Site:HeightVariation object are used by EnergyPlus in conjunction with the Site:WeatherStation object to calculate the local variation in atmospheric properties as a function of height above ground.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Unitary Equipment -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What happens when the chiller reaches the minimum unloading ratio?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group System Availability Managers -> text
input: What is the function of the AvailabilityManager:HighTemperatureTurnOff?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Performance Curves -> text

output: Input for the single rectangular hyperbola type 1 curve consists of the curve name the three coefficients and the maximum and minimum valid independent variable values. Optional inputs for the curve minimum and maximum may be used to limit the output of the performance curve (e.g. limit extrapolation).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Unitary Equipment -> text
input: What should the maximum or design air flow rate through the furnace or unitary system be set to?
output: The maximum or design air flow rate through the furnace or unitary system should usually be set equal to the sum of the maximum air flow rates through the terminal unit objects.

input: What fan type should be used for CyclingFan?
output: A Fan:OnOff should be used.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Advanced Surface Concepts -> text
input: What is required if the 'Field: Constant Temperature Schedule Name' is not blank?
output: If not blank this field must be a valid schedule name.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text
input: How does EnergyPlus determine the overall optical properties of a glazing system?
output: EnergyPlus calculates transmittance and absorptance vs. angle of incidence for each wavelength weights this by a standard solar spectrum to get solar transmittance and absorptance and further weights by the human eye's response for visible transmittance.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Setpoint Managers -> text
input: In what situations is the SetpointManager:ReturnAirBypassFlow scheme particularly useful?
output: In situations where a higher than normal supply air temperature is used such as in underfloor air distribution systems.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Simulation Parameters -> text
input: What happens when one section of a building reflects solar radiation onto another section?
output: In this case one section of the building reflects solar radiation onto another section (and vice-versa).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Performance Curves -> text
input: What is 'Field: Minimum Value of w' in Curve:QuadLinear?
output: The minimum allowable value of w. Values of w less than the minimum will be replaced by the minimum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Variable Refrigerant Flow Equipment -> text
input: What additional consumption rate output variables are included in the heating COP calculation?
output: Crankcase heater evaporative condenser water pump and defrost consumption rate output variables are included in this calculation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Schedules -> text
input: What are the names included in the week description for EnergyPlus schedules?
output: There are names for each individual day of the week plus holiday summer design day winter design day and two more custom day designations.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Performance Curves -> text
input: What does the Curve:ChillerPartLoadWithLift represent?
output: A custom chiller part-load performance curve is a function of three independent variables i.e. x y and z. Input consists of the curve name the twelve coefficients and min and max values for each of the independent variables. Optional inputs for curve minimum and maximum may be used to limit the output of the performance curve.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text
input: What is the condition for two-way flow to occur?
output: Two-way flow occurs only when the neutral plane is within the opening.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Humidifiers and Dehumidifiers -> equation
input: What is the equation for regeneration velocity as a function of process air velocity?
output: The equation is curve = C1 + C2*v + C3*v**2.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: What is the default value for 'Rated Total Cooling Capacity per Unit Length' if the field is blank?
output: The default value is 1900 W/m.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Electric Load Center-Generator Specifications -> text
input: How does a high DC to AC size ratio affect the inverter's operation?
output: For a system with a high DC to AC size ratio during times when the array's DC power output exceeds the inverter's rated DC input size the inverter limits the array's power output by increasing the DC operating voltage which moves the array's operating point down its current-voltage (I-V) curve.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Performance Curves -> text
input: What are the available options for 'Input Unit Type for X'?
output: The available options are Dimensionless Temperature VolumetricFlow MassFlow Distance Power.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: How is the Zone Ventilator Supply Fan Availability Status determined?
output: This status flag is a result of the calculations made by the Availability Manager(s) listed in an AvailabilityManagerAssignmentList object and/or calculations made by Hybrid Ventilation Manager object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group System Availability Managers -> text
input: What is the purpose of the Control Zone or Zone List Name field?
output: For the option CycleOnControlZone this is the name of the control zone or zone list. These zones will activate the central fan for heating or cooling.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: What do the optional input values represent in the water-cooled condenser object?
output: These inputs represent the design values for the refrigerant inventory within the condenser within a receiver beneath the condenser and in the liquid pipes between the condenser and the refrigerated cases.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: What type of fluids are allowed in the fluid-to-fluid heat exchanger?
output: Only hydronic 'plant' fluids are allowed except for Fluid Type 'Steam'; no air-side connections are possible with this heat exchanger.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: What does the 'Area/Person' choice in the 'Number of People Calculation Method' field imply?
output: With this choice the method used will be a factor of floor area per person. The Zone Floor Area per Person field should be filled.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text
input: What is the unit for AFN Zone Ventilation Air Change Rate?
output: The unit for AFN Zone Ventilation Air Change Rate is air changes per hour (ach).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text

output: CoolingCoilAvailSched

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What is the resistive defrost heater capacity?
output: The resistive defrost heater capacity is 20000 Watts.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Advanced Surface Concepts -> equation
input: What is the equation for C2 when Sinusoidal Variation of Constant Temperature Coefficient is set to Yes?
output: C2 = Sin(2π (time of day / period))

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text
input: What is the output for Zone Ventilation Mass Flow Rate?
output: This output is the total mass flow rate into a particular zone from outdoors.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \textbf/ -> text
input: What fraction of radiant energy is incident on Zn002:Wall003?
output: The fraction of radiant energy that is incident on Zn002:Wall003 is 0.04.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What is the minimum value for the evaporative condenser air flow rate field?
output: The minimum value for this field must be greater than zero.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Energy Management System (EMS) -> text
input: What is the purpose of the EndOfZoneSizing calling point?
output: This calling point is useful for taking the intermediate results of zone sizing calculations and modifying them based on custom calculations.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What does the Ratio of Initial Moisture Evaporation Rate and Steady State Latent Capacity field specify?
output: The Ratio of Initial Moisture Evaporation Rate and Steady State Latent Capacity field specifies the ratio of the initial moisture evaporation rate from the cooling coil (when the compressor first turns off in Watts) to the coil's steady-state latent capacity (Watts) at rated airflow and temperature conditions.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: What is the default maximum water outlet temperature for a 'WaterCooled' condenser?
output: The default value is 55 degrees C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: What does the Field: Borehole Length indicate?
output: This numeric field indicates the active length of the borehole referenced from the starting location (potentially below the ground surface) to the end of the borehole in meters.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What is the default value for the Nominal Time for Condensate Removal to Begin field?
output: The default value for the Nominal Time for Condensate Removal to Begin field is zero.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Exhaust Air Flow Rate' allow the user to do?
output: This field allows the user to enter the volumetric flow rate of air (in m³/sec) that will be exhausted to the outdoors.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Location -- Climate -- Weather File Access -> text
input: What does the numeric field for geometric mesh coefficient represent?
output: It represents the compression of cell distribution.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: What is the reporting frequency for Hot Water Equipment Radiant Heating Energy?
output: The reporting frequency for Hot Water Equipment Radiant Heating Energy is Sum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> text
input: What is the 'Field: Name' used for in the context of a Multizone ADU?
output: The 'Field: Name' is used to provide a unique name for the Multizone ADU.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Electric Load Center-Generator Specifications -> text
input: What is the Electric Load Center Requested Electricity Rate?
output: This output variable is the average electric power supply (in watts) requested of the load center by the facility's main distribution panel for the time step being.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Unitary Equipment -> listing

output: Air Loop Outlet Node

output: HVAC Average Zone Hybrid Unitary HVAC System Sensible Cooling Rate [W]

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text

output: The type of shading control type setpoints and several other parameters must be the same in the different WindowShadingControl objects but the shading device and construction can be different.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Location -- Climate -- Weather File Access -> text
input: What does the Site:Precipitation object provide regarding rainfall patterns and rates?
output: Once the typical rainfall pattern and rates are scheduled the Site:Precipitation object provides a method of shifting the total rainfall up or down for design purposes.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: What is the purpose of the Fluid Cooler in terms of water temperature?
output: The Fluid Cooler seeks to maintain the temperature of the water exiting the Fluid Cooler at (or below) a set point.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Controllers -> text
input: How does the outdoor air controller respond to high indoor humidity?
output: The outdoor air flow rate is modified in response to a high indoor humidity condition.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text
input: What does the Field: Minimum Closing Time represent?
output: It represents the minimum time that windows will remain closed.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Electric Load Center-Generator Specifications -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'Temperature Based Exhaust Temperature Curve Name' field?
output: The Exhaust Temperature Curve is a quadratic equation used to determine the exhaust gas temperature as a function of part-load ratio.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: How does the nominal COP differ between heating and cooling objects?
output: For the HeatPump:AirToWater:FuelFired:Heating object it is the fuel-based nominal heating COP; for the HeatPump:AirToWater:FuelFired:Cooling object it is the fuel-based nominal cooling COP.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Variable Refrigerant Flow Equipment -> text
input: How many compressors are there?
output: 3 compressors.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text
input: What are the valid entries for the 'Inlet Air Configuration' field?
output: The valid entries are 'Schedule' 'ZoneAirOnly' 'OutdoorAirOnly' or 'ZoneAndOutdoorAir'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text
input: What does a value of 0 indicate in the AFN Surface Opening Probability Status?
output: A 0 value indicates no opening probability control action.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: What does the Basin Heater Operating Schedule Name field contain?
output: This alpha field contains the name of the basin heater operating schedule.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: What are the electric power inputs to the tower fans metered on?
output: Consumption is metered on HeatRejection:Electricity Electricity:Plant and Electricity:Facility.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What does the 'Zone Packaged Terminal Air Conditioner Sensible Cooling Energy [J]' output field report?
output: This output field reports the moist air sensible heat extraction of the packaged terminal air conditioner from the zone it is serving in Joules over the timestep being reported.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Variable Refrigerant Flow Equipment -> text
input: When is the 'Resistive Defrost Heater Capacity' field used?
output: This input field is used only when the selected defrost strategy is 'resistive'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> listing
input: Provide an example of a Global Infiltration IDF.
output: ZoneListOfficeZonesLeft Fork Middle Fork Right Fork;    ZoneInfiltration:DesignFlowRate    OfficeZones Infiltration    !- Name    OfficeZones       !- Zone or ZoneList Name    Infiltration Sch    !- Schedule Name    AirChanges/Hour     !- Design Flow Rate Calculation Method                !- Design Flow Rate m3/s

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: How is the Zone Water to Air Heat Pump Total Heating Rate reported?
output: This value is calculated for each HVAC system time step being simulated and the results (enthalpy addition only) are averaged for the time step being reported.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What is the purpose of the field 'Design Heat Recovery Water Flow Rate'?
output: This optional numeric field is the design heat recovery plant fluid flow rate if the heat recovery option is being simulated.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> listing

output: ZoneHVAC:WindowAirConditioner Zone3WindAC FanAndCoilAvailSched 0.6 0.05 Zone3WindACAirInletNode Zone3WindACAirOutletNode OutdoorAir:Mixer Zone3WindACOAMixer Fan:SystemModel Zone3WindACFan Zone3WindACDXCoil CyclingFanSch DrawThrough 0.001 Coil:Cooling:DX:SingleSpeed; Schedule:Compact CyclingFanSch Fraction Through: 12/31 For: AllDays Until: 24:00

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: Is there an optional subkey category for the water consumption by evaporation and what is its default?
output: Use of an optional subkey category is also available with default to the General end-use subcategory.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Demand Limiting Controls -> text
input: What does the 'RotateOne' option do in 'Selection Control'?
output: The 'RotateOne' limits only one load which rotates sequentially through the loads listed.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What does the 'Rated Water Flow Rate' field contain?
output: This numeric field contains the rated volumetric water flow rate on the source side of the heat pump in m3/s. This field is autosizable.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Performance Curves -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'Output Unit Type' field?
output: This field is used to indicate the kind of units that may be associated with the output values. It is used by IDF Editor to display the appropriate SI and IP units for the Minimum Curve Output and Maximum Curve Output. The unit conversion is not applied to the coefficients.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text
input: What should be the value for control circuits in relation to adding heat to the tank?
output: Control circuits do not add any heat to the tank and should be 0.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What sets the ambient temperature surrounding the compressor?
output: The ambient temperature surrounding the compressor is set by the Heat Pump:Water Heater parent object (field Compressor Location).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text
input: What does the output variable 'Zone Air Mass Balance Infiltration Mass Flow Rate' represent?
output: This output variable represents the zone infiltration air mass flow rate in kg/s. This output variable is reported only for source zones and when the zone air mass flow balance is active. Its value depends on the Infiltration Balancing Method specified. When the infiltration method is AddInfiltrationFlow this output represents the additional infiltration air mass flow rate added on top of the base infiltration air flow in order to balance the zone air mass flow. In this case the base infiltration air mass flow calculated using the user specified input is assumed self-balanced. When the infiltration method is AdjustInfiltrationFlow and the value of 'Zone Air Mass Balance Infiltration Status' is 1 this output represents the infiltration air mass flow rate required to balance the zone air mass flow. This value could be negative if the zone supply exceeds all other

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Zone Equipment -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Nominal Upstream Leakage Fraction' represent?
output: The 'Field: Nominal Upstream Leakage Fraction' represents the leakage upstream of the terminal unit as a fraction of the design flow rate or maximum available flow rate through the unit.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Electric Load Center-Generator Specifications -> equation
input: What is the equation for Fuel Input in terms of Part Load Ratio (PLR)?
output: Fuel Input = a + b*PLR + c*PLR^2

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Zone Equipment -> text
input: What is the reference for AirTerminal:SingleDuct:VAV:Reheat?
output: The reference for AirTerminal:SingleDuct:VAV:Reheat is \\hyperref[airterminalsingleductvavreheat]AirTerminal:SingleDuct:VAV:Reheat.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text
input: What is the default value if the 'Pressure Control Availability Schedule Name' field is left blank?
output: If this field is left blank the schedule has a value of 1 for all time periods.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Unitary Equipment -> text
input: What does the 'Supply Air Fan Operating Mode Schedule Name' field define?
output: This alpha field defines the name of a schedule that specifies the supply air fan operating mode during the simulation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Electric Load Center-Generator Specifications -> text
input: What objects are used to define the availability and control of electric generators in the simulation?
output: The ElectricLoadCenter:Generators and ElectricLoadCenter:Distribution objects are used to define the availability and control.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What is the latent capacity time constant for Speed 3?
output: The latent capacity time constant for Speed 3 is 0.2 seconds.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What happens if the 'Field: Availability Schedule Name' is left blank?
output: If this field is left blank the schedule has a value of 1.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Unitary Equipment -> text
input: What do hot water and steam heating coils require?
output: The hot water and steam heating coils require specifying plant loop branches and connector objects to support the heating coils and are placed on the demand side of the plant loop.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Unitary Equipment -> text
input: What is the CBVAV unitary system?
output: The changeover-bypass variable air volume (CBVAV) unitary system is a compound object made up of other components.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Simulation Parameters -> equation
input: What is the equation used to calculate the Speed Ratio for a multiple speed coil at speed > 1 using desired outlet temperature?
output: SpeedRatio = (DesOutTemp - OutTempFull_i-1) / (OutTempFull_i - OutTempFull_i-1)

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text
input: What is assumed about the reflected component for the back side slat beam-diffuse solar reflectance?
output: All the reflected component is assumed to be diffuse.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: What should the schedule contain if the design level is the maximum lighting power input?
output: The schedule should contain values between 0.0 and 1.0.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant-Condenser Loops -> text
input: What does the Plant Supply Side Outlet Temperature represent?
output: The Plant Supply Side Outlet Temperature represents the value of the temperature at the outlet to the plant loop on the supply side.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: How is the 'Zone Packaged Terminal Air Conditioner Total Heating Energy [J]' calculated?
output: This value is calculated using the enthalpy difference of the air conditioner outlet air and inlet air streams the air mass flow rate through the air conditioner and the HVAC simulation timestep.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text

output: No the gross heating capacity should not account for the effect of supply air fan heat.

input: What fraction of radiant energy from the heater is distributed to Surface 6?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text

output: The independent variable is the ratio of the actual air flow rate across the heating coil to the rated air flow rate (i.e. fraction of full load flow).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> text
input: Question
output: chunk = Air Temperature from Supplemental Heater \tabularnewline ZoneHVAC:TerminalUnit:VariableRefrigerantFlow \tabularnewline & Cooling Supply Air Flow Rate \tabularnewline & No Cooling Supply Air Flow Rate \tabularnewline & Heating Supply Air Flow Rate \tabularnewline & No Heating Supply Air Flow Rate \tabularnewline & Cooling Outdoor Air Flow Rate \tabularnewline & Heating Outdoor Air Flow Rate \tabularnewline & No Load Outdoor Air Flow Rate \tabularnewline ZoneHVAC:UnitHeater \tabularnewline & Maximum Supply Air Flow Rate \tabularnewline & Maximum Hot Water or Steam Flow Rate \tabularnewline ZoneHVAC:UnitVentilator \tabularnewline & Maximum Supply Air Flow Rate \tabularnewline & Minimum Outdoor Air Flow Rate \tabularnewline & Maximum Outdoor Air Flow Rate \tabularnewline ZoneHVAC:VentilatedSlab \tabularnewline & Maximum Air Flow Rate \tabularnewline & Minimum Outdoor Air Flow Rate \tabularnewline & Maximum Outdoor Air Flow Rate \tabularnewline ZoneHVAC:WaterToAirHeatPump \tabularnewline & Cooling Supply Air Flow Rate \tabularnewline & Heating Supply Air Flow Rate \tabularnewline & No Load Supply Air Flow Rate \tabularnewline & Cooling Outdoor Air Flow Rate \tabularnewline & Heating Outdoor Air Flow Rate \tabularnewline & No Load Outdoor Air Flow Rate \tabularnewline & Maximum Supply Air Temperature from Supplemental Heater \tabularnewline ZoneHVAC:WindowAirConditioner \tabularnewline & Maximum Supply Air Flow Rate \tabularnewline & Maximum Outdoor Air Flow Rate \tabularnewline \bottomrule \endlongtable There are 3 places in the input where the user can impose sizing factors. 1.~~~~In Sizing Parameters (object: \hyperref[sizingparameters]Sizing:Parameters) the user can specify an over-all sizing factor. This factor is applied to all the zone design loads and air flow rates resulting from the zone sizing calculations. 2.~~~~In Zone Sizing (object: \hyperref[sizingzone]Sizing:Zone) the user can specify a sizing factor for a specific zone. The factor is applied to the calculated zone design loads and air flow rates for the zone named in the \hyperref[sizingzone]Sizing:Zone object. This sizing factor overrides the global sizing factor. That is a zone sizing factor if specified replaces the global sizing factor for the named zone. 3.~~~~For some plant components (basically all central chillers boilers and cooling towers) the user can specify a sizing factor that modifies the autosized component capacity and flow rates. These factors are applied after the application of global or zone sizing factors. They are primarily used to split the design load between multiple components. These sizing factors can change the autosizing of the associated loops and pumps. The following rules are followed the effect of plant component sizing factors on loops and pumps. a.~~~~For supply side branches the sizing factors of all components in series on the branch are summed and the result becomes the branch sizing factor. If there is a branch pump its autosized design flow rate is multiplied by the branch sizing factor. b.~~~For each loop if the average of the branch sizing factors is less than 1 the loop sizing factor is set equal to the sum of the branch sizing factors. If the average is greater than 1 the loop sizing factor is set equal to the maximum of the branch sizing factors. The loop sizing factor is applied to the loop design flow rate (if autosized) and to the loop pump flow rate (if autosized). \subsubsectionMixing User-Specified and Autosized Inputs\labelmixing-user-specified-and-autosized-inputs Mixed user-specified and autosized inputs can be successfully used if the following points and suggestions are followed. 1.~~~~Each component is autosized independently. Thus user input for a flow rate in one component will have no effect on other components autosized flow rates. For instance specifying the chilled water loop pump s rated flow rate will have no effect on the autosizing of the chiller s design evaporator flow rate or on the plant loop s autosized maximum loop flow rate. 2.~~~~Within a component it is best

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Air Path -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Performance Curves -> text

output: The 'Roughness' field represents the first method to simulate frictional losses. It is used to develop the friction factor (f) and has units of m if entered. It allows the friction calculation to be dynamic throughout the simulation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Operational Faults -> text

output: It measures the combined beam and diffuse solar that first entered adjacent zones through exterior windows was reflected from interior surfaces becoming diffuse and then transmitted through interior windows into the current enclosure.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: How is the Cooling Coil Condensate Volume value calculated?
output: This value is calculated for each HVAC system timestep and the results are summed for the timestep being reported.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What does the 'Maximum Part Load Ratio' field contain?
output: This numeric field contains the maximum part load ratio. If the ratio of demand to boiler nominal capacity is greater than the maximum part load ratio then the Max PLR will determine the operating PLR. This value may exceed 1 but the normal range is between 0 and 1.1. If this field is left blank the default value is 1.0.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What must be specified in conjunction with the Heat Recovery Outlet Node Name?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text
input: What is ZoneCrossMixing?
output: ZoneCrossMixing is ideally suited for two zones that exchange an equal amount of air between each other. It is a simplified interzone airflow in EnergyPlus with the main difference from ZoneMixing being that cross mixing affects both the source and receiving zones maintaining both air mass and energy balances.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \textbf/ -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Variable Refrigerant Flow Equipment -> text
input: What type of curve is used for the cooling energy input ratio boundary?
output: This curve is a linear quadratic or cubic curve that defines a change in cooling energy at a specific condenser entering air dry-bulb temperature as a function of indoor air wet-bulb temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Advanced Surface Concepts -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Controllers -> text
input: What happens if the field for minimum outdoor air flow rate is not entered?
output: If this field is not entered the minimum outdoor air flow rate either remains constant during the simulation period (Minimum Outdoor Air Control Type = FixedMinimum) or varies in proportion to the supply air flow rate (Minimum Outdoor Air Control Type = ProportionalMinimum).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> text
input: What does 'SupplyAirFlowRate' mean in the 'Heating Design Air Flow Method' field?
output: It means the user specifies the magnitude of supply air flow rate or the program calculates the design heating supply air volume flow rate if autosize is specified.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text

output: The rated volumetric air flow to total cooling capacity ratio for 100% dedicated outdoor air (DOAS) application DX cooling coils should be between 0.00001677 (m³/s)/W (125 cfm/ton) and 0.00003355 (m³/s)/W (250 cfm/ton).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heat Recovery -> text

output: RTO represents the Regeneration outlet air dry-bulb temperature (C).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Demand Limiting Controls -> text
input: What does the Fixed option do in the Limit Control field?
output: The Fixed option reduces the power to the controlled loads by a fixed amount determined by the Maximum Limit Fraction field.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group User Defined HVAC and Plant Component Models -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'Number of Plant Loop Connections' field?
output: This field defines the number of different plant loop connections that the zone unit will use. Up to three separate loops can be connected if desired. This field is required. Enter a 0 if the unit does not use plant at all.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What is the unit for 'Window Net Heat Transfer Energy'?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text

output: N8 is ARI C10 N9 is ARI C8 and N10 is ARI C9.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Performance Curves -> text
input: What is the 'Field: Minimum Value of y' used for?
output: The minimum allowable value of y. Values of y less than the minimum will be replaced by the minimum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What is specified by the numeric field for water pump power?
output: This numeric field defines the coil's water circulation pump power in Watts. This is the operating pump power as installed. Values must be greater than or equal to 0. If this field is left blank the default value is 0. A warning message will be issued if the ratio of water pump power to desuperheater water volumetric flow rate exceeds 7.9264E6 W/m³/s but the simulation will continue using the user-defined values. The model assumes that this integral pump (i.e. no need to define a separate pump object) cycles on and off with the desuperheater heating coil.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: Why is a building surface necessary?
output: A building surface is necessary for all calculations.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> code listing
input: What is the Water Vapor Diffusion Resistance Factor for gypsum board?
output: The Water Vapor Diffusion Resistance Factor for gypsum board is 6.0.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text
input: What are the outputs for Zone Ventilation Standard Density Volume and Volume Flow Rate?
output: These outputs are the total volume and volume flow rate of ventilation air based on the standard density of air.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Electric Load Center-Generator Specifications -> text
input: What does the 'Module Cut-off Voltage' field specify?
output: This field specifies the minimum allowable voltage below which the battery is generally regarded as empty.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> text
input: What is the purpose of adjusting the minimum airflow turndown value?
output: This field adjusts the minimum airflow turndown value below the zone design minimum air flow and is intended for use with ASHRAE Standard 170.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Room Air Models -> text
input: In what situations should the RoomAirSettings:UnderFloorAirDistributionInterior model be used with caution?
output: The model should be used with caution in zones which have large heat gains or losses through exterior walls or windows or which have considerable direct solar gain.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: How is the Zone Packaged Terminal Air Conditioner Total Heating Energy calculated?
output: The Zone Packaged Terminal Air Conditioner Total Heating Energy is the total (enthalpy) heat addition of the packaged terminal air conditioner to the zone it is serving in Joules over the timestep being reported. It is calculated using the enthalpy difference of the air conditioner outlet air and inlet air streams the air mass flow rate through the air conditioner and the HVAC simulation timestep. It is calculated for each HVAC system timestep being simulated and the results (enthalpy addition only) are summed for the timestep being reported.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What does the choice 'BlowThrough' mean for fan placement?
output: The first choice stands for 'blow through fan'. This means that the unit consists of an outdoor air mixer followed by a fan followed by a DX coil. The fan 'blows through' the DX coil.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: How are SEER2 User and SEER2 Standard calculated?
output: SEER2 User is calculated using user-input PLF curve and cooling coefficient of degradation; SEER2 Standard is calculated using AHRI Std 210/240-2023 default PLF curve and cooling coefficient of degradation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Humidifiers and Dehumidifiers -> text
input: What are examples of set point managers that can be used for humidity control?
output: Examples include 'SetpointManager:SingleZone:Humidity:Maximum' and 'SetpointManager:OutdoorAirPretreat'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: How should the air flow fraction curve be normalized?
output: The curve should be normalized to have the value of 1.0 at the rated evaporator air flow rate (air flow fraction of 1.0).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Advanced Surface Concepts -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Electric Load Center-Generator Specifications -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text
input: What does the 'Standard' choice mean for 'Single Sided Wind Pressure Coefficient Algorithm'?
output: A single wind pressure coefficient is applied to all openings in the zone as calculated using SurfaceAverageCalculation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Location -- Climate -- Weather File Access -> text
input: What does the 'Name of Undisturbed Ground Temperature Object' field specify?
output: This field specifies the name of the undisturbed ground temperature object that is used to determine the ground temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: What happens if the 'GHE:ResponseFactors object' is not provided?
output: If the GHE:ResponseFactors object is not provided this input will be relevant to the calculation method used to generate the g-function values. There are two options for this input: 'UHFcalc' or 'UBHWTcalc'. The default is UHFcalc where a g-function is computed with the uniform heat flux boundary condition. The UBHWTcalc option computes the g-function with a uniform borehole wall temperature boundary condition. The g-function computed with a uniform borehole wall temperature boundary condition is expected to be a better approximation of the borehole physics and is also expected to be faster to compute.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What does the window assume from the base surface?
output: The window assumes the outward facing angle as well as the tilt angle of the base surface.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: How can the Zone Zonelist or SpaceList options be used effectively?
output: They can be used effectively with the watts/area and watts/person options of the Design Level Calculation Method to place a varying equipment load at the same density in each zone or space.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: What is the OperationSchemeModulated control mode applicable to?
output: It is applicable to situations where the heat exchanger is controlled by an operation scheme.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text
input: In which zones will mixing and infiltration adjustments be made?
output: Mixing and infiltration adjustments will only be made in zones which have zone mixing or infiltration objects defined in the input.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: What does the field 'Alternate Operating Mode 2' specify?
output: The name corresponding to a Coil:Cooling:DX:CurveFit:OperatingMode object. Operating Mode is used to represent a reheat mode as a subcool reheat coil.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group User Defined HVAC and Plant Component Models -> text
input: What does the 'Plant Connection 2 Outlet Node Name' field define?
output: This field defines the name of a plant system node to which the air terminal unit can send fluid. This is the outlet from the component model to the second plant loop that is connected to the air terminal unit.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group System Availability Managers -> text
input: What does a value of 0 indicate for the 'Availability Manager Night Cycle Control Status'?
output: A value of 0 indicates the manager is signaling 'NoAction'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: How is the adjusted evaporator capacity used in the cooling part-load calculation?
output: This adjusted capacity is used as part of the cooling part-load calculation for the EIRFPLR curve.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What is the Field: Evaporative Condenser Air Flow Rate used for?
output: The air volume flow rate in \si\volumeFlowRate entering the evaporative condenser is used to calculate the amount of water used to evaporatively cool the condenser inlet air.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> table row
input: What is the Speed 4 Total WH Capacity Function of Temperature Curve Name?
output: HPWHHeatingCapFTemp

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: How is the Coil System Water Sensible Cooling Rate calculated?
output: Using the enthalpy difference of the coil system outlet air and inlet air streams at a constant humidity ratio and the air mass flow rate through the coil system.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Detailed Ground Heat Transfer -> text

If it has been previously executed the results are stored in the .BSMT file and do not necessarily need to be run again unless the GroundHeatTransfer:Basement objects have changed.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Setpoint Managers -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Location -- Climate -- Weather File Access -> text

output: Enter the heating capacity as a fraction of the autosized heating capacity of low temperature radiant electric unit.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: When may latent capacity degradation be significant for a single multi-speed compressor?
output: Latent capacity degradation may only be significant when the compressor cycles between speed 1 and off but the losses may be extremely small when the compressor operates between speed 1 and speed 2 (or between speeds 2 and 3 etc.).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: How is the energy input ratio (EIR) related to the coefficient of performance (COP)?
output: The EIR is the inverse of the COP.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heat Recovery -> list item

output: HVACAverageHeat Exchanger Latent Cooling Rate [W]

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Daylighting -> table row: Daylighting Modeling Options
input: How is diffusing (translucent) glass added?
output: Add diffusing (translucent) glass using WindowMaterial:Glazing/Solar Diffusing = Yes*.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Fans -> text
input: What does the 'Air Outlet Node Name' field specify?
