instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What is the Zone Outdoor Air Drybulb Temperature?
output: The outdoor air dry-bulb temperature calculated at the height above ground of the zone centroid.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Fans -> text
input: How is the power delivered to the fluid calculated?
output: The power delivered to the fluid is the mass flow rate of the air multiplied by the pressure rise divided by the air density.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What does the field 'Sizing Factor' allow the user to specify?
output: This optional numeric field allows the user to specify a sizing factor for this component.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Controllers -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'Minimum Outdoor Air Schedule Name' field?
output: The name of a schedule which uses decimal values (e.g. 0.0 or 1.0). These values are multiplied by the minimum outdoor air flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What are the additional outputs for air-cooled or evap-cooled chillers?
output: For air-cooled or evap-cooled chillers: HVACAverageChiller Condenser Inlet Temperature [C].

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> text
input: What does sensible cooling by the beams in the zone exclude?
output: Sensible cooling by the beams in the zone excludes any cooling or heating done by the supply air.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: What does the electric equipment electric power consumption sum consist of?
output: The electric equipment electric power consumption in Watts (for power) or Joules (for energy). It is the sum of the radiant convective latent and lost components.

input: What is the Rated Condenser Water Flow Rate in m3/s?

output: The default is 2.0 for active beams.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heat Recovery -> text
input: When is the electric power consumed according to the 'Field: Nominal Electric Power'?
output: This electric power is considered constant and is consumed only when the heat exchanger operates.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: When is the Temperature Setpoint Node Name not required?
output: If the coil is used in an air terminal unit or other parent object (ZoneHVAC: or AirloopHVAC:) the coil is controlled by the parent object and the temperature set point node name is not required.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Water Outlet Node Name' contain?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text

output: Watt per Watt (W/W)

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Water Systems -> text
input: What is the purpose of the Field: Name?
output: The unique object name for reference by other objects.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text
input: What is the AFN Zone Mixing Sensible Heat Loss Energy?
output: The AFN Zone Mixing Sensible Heat Loss Energy is the total convective sensible heat loss in Joules to the zone air corresponding to the Zone Mixing Volume summed over the reporting period.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Simulation Parameters -> text
input: What is the CeilingDiffuser model?
output: The CeilingDiffuser model is a mixed and forced convection model for ceiling diffuser configurations. The model correlates the heat transfer coefficient to the air change rate for ceilings walls and floors.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> text
input: When can the heating capacity input field be left blank?
output: This field may be left blank if a heating coil is not included in the airloop or alternative method is specified.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What is used for a scheduled condition in the 'Temperature Specification Type' field?
output: For a scheduled condition the name of a schedule (the following field) is used to allow the temperature to vary throughout the simulation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: How is water consumption calculated for evaporatively-cooled condensers?
output: The water consumed by the evaporatively-cooled condenser is proportional to the chiller condenser heat transfer.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> text
input: What is the 'Field: Name' input for a Series PIU Terminal Unit?
output: A unique user assigned name for a particular series powered induction terminal unit. Any reference to this unit by another object will use this name.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text
input: What effect does the input object add to the phase change process?
output: This input object adds a hysteresis effect allowing the melting/freezing process to follow different curves.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'Storage Tank to Ambient U-value Times Area Heat Transfer Coefficient [W/K]' field?
output: This field is used to characterize the rate at which heat is exchanged between the TES tank and the surrounding ambient conditions in W/K.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text
input: What is the peak freezing temperature of the material?
output: The peak freezing temperature is 1 C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What is the 'Zone Packaged Terminal Heat Pump Sensible Heating Energy' output field?
output: This output field is the sensible heat addition of the packaged terminal heat pump to the zone it is serving in Joules over the timestep being reported.

input: What is the setpoint in W/m2?

output: The key choice options include: WaltonStableHorizontalOrTilt AlamdariHammondStableHorizontal or UserCurve.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Variable Refrigerant Flow Equipment -> text
input: What is the VRF Heat Pump Basin Heater Electricity Rate?
output: It is an average HVAC output variable measured in Watts (W).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Unitary Equipment -> text
input: What must the values be for the no load supply air flow rate?
output: Values must be greater than or equal to zero or this field is autosizable.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: How is the view factor to the sky for diffuse solar radiation calculated?
output: It is calculated within EnergyPlus based on surface orientation sky solar radiance distribution and shadowing surfaces.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What does the 'U-Factor Times Area Curve' describe?
output: The U-Factor Times Area (UA) is an equation that determines the overall heat transfer coefficient for the exhaust gasses with the stack.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Air Path -> text
input: What should not be used as the zone node name in the 'Field: Zone Node Name'?
output: Do not use the Zone Air Node Name specified in any ZoneHVAC:EquipmentConnections object and since this zone is a plenum a ZoneHVAC:EquipmentConnections object is not required for the zone named in the previous field.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Setpoint Managers -> text
input: With what is the Coldest Setpoint Manager usually used in conjunction?
output: Usually it is used in conjunction with a SetpointManager:Warmest resetting the temperature of the air in the cooling supply duct.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Location -- Climate -- Weather File Access -> text
input: Is the 'name' input field required?
output: The 'name' input field is not required.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> table row: Maximum Motor Output Power
input: What is the maximum motor output power for Fan:ComponentModel?
output: Maximum Motor Output Power

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text
input: Is the 'Maximum Outdoor Temperature Schedule Name' field mandatory?
output: This field is an optional field. If this field is not entered the maximum outdoor temperature control is not applied.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text
input: What does a schedule value greater than 0 indicate?
output: A schedule value greater than 0 (usually 1 is used) indicates that the system is available and can be on during the time period.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: How is volume calculated if a positive ceiling height is entered?
output: The volume will be calculated as the floor area (if > 0) times the entered ceiling height; else the volume will be calculated from the described surfaces.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: What does the 'Design Entering Air Wet-bulb Temperature' field contain?
output: The 'Design Entering Air Wet-bulb Temperature' field contains the entering air wet-bulb temperature at nominal conditions in degrees Celsius.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: How is the approach temperature defined?
output: The approach temperature is the outlet water temperature minus the inlet air wet-bulb temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Simulation Parameters -> text
input: What warning is posted when detailed modeling is done and the Calculation Frequency is greater than 1?
output: A warning is posted if the Calculation Frequency is greater than 1 when detailed modeling is done.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: Where can the fan be positioned in relation to the cooler(s)?
output: The fan can be positioned upstream of the cooler(s) for a blow through placement or it can be positioned downstream of the cooler(s) for a draw through placement.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: What is the unit of Refrigeration Air Chiller System Total High Stage Compressor Electricity Energy?
output: The unit of Refrigeration Air Chiller System Total High Stage Compressor Electricity Energy is Joules (J).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Variable Refrigerant Flow Equipment -> text
input: How is the VRF system model connected to a zone?
output: It is connected via the zone inlet and exhaust nodes connected to an air loop main branch or installed in the air loop's outdoor air system.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: What is the result of the curve object evaluation?
output: The output from the curve is multiplied by the design compressor rack COP to yield the actual COP at the specific air temperature entering the condenser.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What does the output variable 'Integrated Heat Pump Source Heat Transfer Energy' represent?
output: The output variable is the total source energy output of the integrated heat pump in joules absorbed or discharged to the outdoor air over the timestep being reported.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Advanced Surface Concepts -> table row: Key choice and Applies to Inside or Outside
input: What does the 'Mitchell' key choice apply to?
output: Outside

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Electric Load Center-Generator Specifications -> text
input: Is the no load loss in transformers constant?
output: Yes it is roughly constant and exists continuously in the core material as long as the transformer is energized.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> text
input: Is the applicable sizing factor applied to Cooling Minimum Air Flow?
output: The applicable sizing factor is not applied to this value.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Room Air Models -> text
input: What factors can cause the area of the inflow aperture to change?
output: The area can change due to variation in wind direction (as inflow aperture changes) or variations in the opening schedule.

output: If the entered zone ceiling height differs significantly from the calculated height a warning message will be issued.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: How is the fraction applied in the 'Condenser Heat Recovery Relative Capacity Fraction' field?
output: This fraction will be applied to the full heat rejection when operating at nominal capacity and nominal COP to model a capacity limit for the heat rejection.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Advanced Surface Concepts -> text
input: What is the requirement for windows in EnergyPlus?
output: Windows in EnergyPlus need to be rectangular.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Performance Curves -> text
input: What option is currently provided for the input unit type for x?
output: At this time only the Dimensionless option is provided so that no unit conversion is used for this curve.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Pumps -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Inlet Node Name' contain?
output: This alpha field contains the identifying name for the pump bank inlet node.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Electric Load Center-Generator Specifications -> text
input: How does the internal resistance of a battery vary theoretically?
output: The electrical resistance within the battery varies with the state of charge and depends on whether it is in charging or discharging.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: What is the 'ZoneSumRefrigeration Case Evaporator Fan Electricity Energy'?
output: It is the sum of electricity energy of the refrigeration case evaporator fan in Joules.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \textbf/ -> text
input: What is the 'Field: Name' used for in the 'ZoneHVAC:LowTemperatureRadiant:ConstantFlow:Design' object?
output: This field is a unique user assigned name for an instance of a constant flow low temperature radiant system design object. Any reference to this unit by another object will use this name.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Controllers -> text
input: Is the Economizer Maximum Limit Dry-Bulb Temperature limit applied regardless of the specified Economizer Control Type?
output: If non-blank this limit is applied regardless of the specified Economizer Control Type.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Performance Curves -> text
input: What are the available unit options for z?
output: The available options are Dimensionless Temperature VolumetricFlow MassFlow Power Distance VolumetricFlowPerPower.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text
input: What is the 'AFN Zone Duct Leaked Air Latent Heat Gain Energy'?
output: This is the total latent heat gain in Joules to a specific zone due to supply air leaks summed over the reporting period. When a Fan:OnOff object is used the reported value is for the system on cycle.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: What does 'Refrigeration System Condenser Total Recovered Heat Transfer Rate' include?
output: Refrigeration System Condenser Total Recovered Heat Transfer Rate includes the total heat recovered from the condenser inlet flow for all purposes including defrost and water or air heating measured in Watts.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \textbf/ -> text
input: What is the default value for the 'Fraction of Autosized Cooling Design Capacity' field?
output: The default value is 1.0.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \textbf/ -> text
input: What does a schedule value greater than 0 mean for the radiant cooling panel?
output: A schedule value greater than 0 (usually 1 is used) indicates that the unit can be on during the hour.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Evaporative Coolers -> text
input: What are typical values for the 'Blowdown Concentration Ratio'?
output: Typical values are 3 to 5.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What does Neutral control do in zone forced air units?
output: Neutral control tries to have no energy impact on the zone by delivering air at the temperature of the zone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What does the 'Timed Empirical Defrost Frequency Curve Name' field specify?
output: This optional alpha field specifies the name of a univariate curve or table that defines the frequency of defrost based on outdoor temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text
input: What are Large Vertical Openings (LVOs) in the Airflow Network?
output: Open windows or doors are also called Large Vertical Openings (LVOs).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text
input: What happens if the 'Field: Reference Crack Conditions' is omitted and only one AirflowNetwork:MultiZone:ReferenceCrackConditions object is defined?
output: If the 'Field: Reference Crack Conditions' is omitted and only one AirflowNetwork:MultiZone:ReferenceCrackConditions object is defined in the input data file then those reference crack conditions will be used.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Air Path -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'Field: Name' in the AirLoopHVAC:SupplyPath?
output: The 'Field: Name' provides a unique name to identify the supply air path.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Performance Tables -> table row: Table with independent variables and output
input: What are the values for iv1 iv2 iv3 and the output in the fourteenth row of the table?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Air Distribution -> text
input: What does the 'Air System Simulation Cycle On Off Status' field represent?
output: This field is the availability status of an AirLoopHVAC determined by the System Availability Manager(s) in a System Availability Manager List. It uses integers 0 through 3 to represent different statuses: NoAction (0) ForceOff (1) CycleOn (2) and CycleOnZoneFansOnly (3).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text
input: What does k_1 represent in the thermal conductivity equation?
output: k_1 is the change in conductivity per degree temperature difference from 20°C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What is the nominal time for condensate removal to begin for DXSystem 1 DX Coil SubCoolReheat Mode-Stage 1&2?
output: 1000 seconds.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What does the 'SCDWH Mode Minimum Speed' field define?
output: This numeric field defines a minimum speed level for running the SCDWH; i.e. the compressor speed will be altered between the minimum speed specified and top speed to match the space cooling load and the water heating energy is a byproduct.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Water Systems -> text
input: What happens if the hot water flow is not hot enough in the WaterUse:Equipment object?
output: If the hot water flow is not hot enough or if the flow is limited by plant loop constraints the result is a cooler mixed water temperature and the target temperature will not be met.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Pumps -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'Field: Design Electric Power per Unit Flow Rate'?
output: This input is used when the input field Design Power Consumption is set to autosize and the Design Power Sizing Method is set to PowerPerFlow allowing setting the efficiency of the pumping system's power consumption using only the design flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: What is the nominal speed number in the compressor operation?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Reference Heating Power Consumption' contain?
output: This numeric field contains the design electric power consumption for heating in W. This corresponds to the electric power use at the Reference Heating Capacity. This field is autosizable. When autosized the field called Reference Coefficient of Performance must be used.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Location -- Climate -- Weather File Access -> text
input: What is the purpose of the Field: Wind Speed Profile Exponent?
output: The wind speed profile exponent is for the terrain surrounding the site and can be estimated from the table or calculated using sophisticated techniques.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Water Systems -> text
input: What does the 'Water System Groundwater Well Volume Flow Rate' output variable indicate?
output: This is the volume flow of water actually obtained from the well in units of cubic meters per second (m³/s).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text
input: What is specified in the Field: Source Zone or Space Name?
output: This field is the name of the 'source' zone or space that exhausts the amount of air specified by the design level and schedule fields to the zone named in the zone name field.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> text
input: What is the design supply air temperature for cooling?
output: The design supply air temperature for cooling is in degrees Celsius and it should be the temperature of the air exiting the central cooling coil.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Electric Load Center-Generator Specifications -> listing
input: Provide an example input of the ElectricLoadCenter:Transformer input.
output: An example input of the ElectricLoadCenter:Transformer input is: \nElectricLoadCenter:Transformer

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What should the gross rated total cooling capacity gross rated SHR and gross rated COP be?
output: The gross rated total cooling capacity gross rated SHR and gross rated COP should be performance information for the unit with air entering the cooling coil at 26.7°C drybulb/19.4°C wetbulb air entering the outdoor condenser coil at 35°C drybulb/23.9°C wetbulb air.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: How is the runtime fraction of the coil defined?
output: The runtime fraction of the coil is defined as PLR divided by PLF.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group System Availability Managers -> text
input: What do schedule values greater than zero indicate?
output: Schedule values greater than zero (usually 1 is used) indicate that the system is on.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What is the minimum air to water temperature offset?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What should be included when describing an internal wall within the same zone?
output: If both sides of a wall are completely within the same zone then the area of both sides must be included when describing that internal wall.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: What does ν_d represent in the deposition velocity model equation?
output: Deposition velocity [m/s]

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: What does 125% of the 'Standard Design Capacity' give?
output: 125% of this capacity gives the actual fluid cooler heat rejection at these operating conditions.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow -> text
input: What is the default value for the Earth Tube Nodes Below parameter?
output: The default value for this parameter is 3 (nodes) or the minimum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Variable Refrigerant Flow Equipment -> text
input: What happens if the maximum condenser inlet node temperature in heat recovery mode is exceeded?
output: Above this temperature heat recovery is disabled.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Location -- Climate -- Weather File Access -> text
input: What happens when using the Site:HeightVariation object with respect to wind speed profile coefficients?
output: Using this object overrides the wind speed profile coefficients implied by the Terrain field of the Building object even if the wind speed profile fields are left blank.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: What is the unit for Cooling Coil Air Inlet Temperature?
output: C

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> text
input: What is the purpose of the Zone Minimum Air Flow Method field?
output: The Zone Minimum Air Flow Method field is used to select how the program will determine the minimum flow rate to the zone while the system is operating.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text
input: What does the output 'CondFD EMS Heat Source Energy After Layer' represent?
output: This output represents the heat energy added after material layer N from the EMS heat flux actuator.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Unitary Equipment -> text
input: How is the speed number determined in 'Single Mode Operation'?
output: The speed number is determined by a system load.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Setpoint Managers -> text
input: What does the 'Control Variable' field specify?
output: The 'Control Variable' field specifies the type of variable that will be controlled such as Temperature MaximumHumidityRatio MinimumHumidityRatio or HumidityRatio.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Controllers -> text
input: How must the economizer meet the cooling load with LockoutWithCompressor?
output: The economizer must meet the entire cooling load; it is not allowed to operate in conjunction with the DX cooling coil.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Variable Refrigerant Flow Equipment -> text
input: When is the input for heating capacity reduction used?
output: This input is used when Heat Pump Waste Heat Recovery is selected as Yes and the system changes from heating only mode to heat recovery mode.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Solar Collectors -> text
input: How should PVT solar collectors be connected for thermal energy utilization?
output: The PVT solar collectors need to be connected to either an HVAC air system or a plant loop for collected thermal energy to be utilized.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: How is the volume calculated if the ceiling height is positive?
output: If this field is positive any ceiling height positive value will not be used in volume calculations.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: How is a zone coil controlled?
output: A zone coil is load controlled.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Zone Controls - Thermostats and Humidistats -> text
input: What is 'Facility Heating Setpoint Not Met Time [hr]'?
output: It is the hours when the zone temperature is lower than 0.2 (default) degrees C below the heating setpoint in any one or more zones.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text
input: What must be true if the name of an opening component is given in the 'Leakage Component Name' field?
output: If the name of an opening component (i.e. AirflowNetwork:MultiZone:Component:DetailedOpening AirflowNetwork:MultiZone:Component:HorizontalOpening or AirflowNetwork:MultiZone:Component:SimpleOpening) is given here then the Surface Name in the previous field must be that of a window door or glass door heat transfer subsurface or a building surface which is an air boundary. Otherwise an error message will be reported.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Location -- Climate -- Weather File Access -> text
input: What is the 'Field: Soil Moisture Content Volume Fraction'?
output: A nominal value of soil moisture content to be used when evaluating soil thermal properties.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Node-Branch Management -> text
input: What is the purpose of the Field: Outlet Node Name for Pipe:Adiabatic?
output: This alpha field is used as an identifying field for the pipe outlet node.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: Is the 'Charge Only Mode Available' field required?
output: Yes this field is required.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text
input: How can air flow move in large vertical openings according to the AirflowNetwork model?
output: Such openings can have air flow moving simultaneously in two different directions depending on stack effects and wind conditions (for example flow from inside to outside at the top of a window and from outside to inside at the bottom).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text
input: What does the 'Condensate Piping Refrigerant Inventory' field specify?
output: This numeric field specifies the amount of refrigerant present within the condensate piping (kg) specified by the system designer under standard rating conditions.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What are the valid choices for 'Field: Run On Sensible Load'?
output: There are two valid choices Yes or No.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Location -- Climate -- Weather File Access -> text
input: What does the Irrigation Maximum Saturation Threshold field do?
output: It is used with the SmartSchedule option to override the default 40% saturation limit for turning off the irrigation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> text
input: Where can VAV systems be used?
output: VAV systems can be used for interior or perimeter zones with a common fan system air temperature control and reheating devices.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Simulation Parameters -> text
input: What does the Advanced option in Override Mode allow?
output: The Advanced option allows the MaxZoneTempDiff and MaxAllowedDelTemp fields of the PerformancePrecisionTradeoffs to be used.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Daylighting -> text
input: What does DElight deal with in terms of light transmitted through a Complex Fenestration?
output: DElight only deals with the visible spectrum of light transmitted through a Complex Fenestration.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text
input: What is the 'Viscosity Coefficient C' used for?
output: The 'Viscosity Coefficient C' is used for gas viscosity (kg/m-s-K^2) and is used only if Gas Type = Custom.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Performance Curves -> text
input: What is the 'Curve:QuadraticLinear'?
output: This curve is a function of two independent variables. Input consists of the curve name the six coefficients and min and max values for each of the independent variables. Optional inputs for curve minimum and maximum may be used to limit the output of the performance curve (e.g. limit extrapolation).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Fans -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'Field: Name' in Fan:SystemModel?
output: A unique name for this fan. Any reference to this fan by another object will use this name.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone HVAC Air Loop Terminal Units -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'Beam Rated Heating Room Air Hot Water Temperature Difference' input?
output: It helps to define the operating conditions that correspond with Rated Beam Heating Capacity per Meter.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What is the Speed 7 Reference Unit Gross Rated Heating Capacity?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Humidifiers and Dehumidifiers -> text
input: What information does the 'Humidifier:Electricity [J]' meter output provide?
output: It provides the sum of the electricity consumed (in Joules during the report timestep) by all the steam humidifiers at the HVAC level in the simulation.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: What is the name of the coil model mentioned?
output: Coil:Cooling:DX:CurveFit:OperatingMode.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: How is the Zone Ventilator Latent Cooling Energy reported?
output: This value is calculated for each HVAC system timestep being simulated and the results (latent heat extraction only) are summed for the timestep being reported.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> figure in /UAStudy/EnergyPlus/doc/input-output-reference/media/

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> figure in /UAStudy/EnergyPlus/doc/input-output-reference/media/
input: What does Figure 24 illustrate?

output: The CoolReheat option requires the use of a heating coil and heating coil outlet air temperature set point manager downstream of this cooling coil to maintain the temperature set point.

input: What does the 'Off' option do in the 'Limit Control' field?

input: What does the output variable 'Heat Pump Source Side Mass Flow Rate [kg/s]' represent?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Water Heaters and Thermal Storage -> text

input: What are the European Standard and Nominal ratings for CapacityTotalSpecificConditions?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Location -- Climate -- Weather File Access -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What does the 'Heat Recovery Capacity Modifier Function of Temperature Curve Name' field define?
output: This field is the name of a bivariate curve or table that defines an available capacity modifier of the unit as a function of the load side outlet temperature and the heat recovery side inlet temperature. The temperatures are in degrees Celsius when used in the function and the output of the function is multiplied by the reference capacity to get a current available capacity when the unit is operating in heat recovery mode.

This optional argument is only required if horizontal insulation is present.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Fans -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text
input: What information does 'CondFD Surface Heat Flux Node <X> [W/m2]' provide?
output: This will output heat flux at each node in surfaces being simulated with ConductionFiniteDifference. The key values for this output variable are the surface name. The nodes are numbered from outside to inside of the surface. The full listing will appear in the RDD file. A positive value indicates heat flowing towards the inside face of the surface. Note that this matches the sign convention for Surface Inside Face Conduction Heat Transfer Rate per Area and is opposite the sign of Surface Outside Face Conduction Heat Transfer Rate per Area.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What does the 'Zone Hybrid Unitary HVAC Supply Air Temperature' output report?
output: It reports the supply air temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: Where are the specific 'Exhaust Fired Absorption Chiller' output variables and exceptions to the generic outputs defined?
output: The specific 'Exhaust Fired Absorption Chiller' output variables and exceptions to the generic outputs are defined below.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What are the x values for the performance curve?
output: The x values for the performance curve are the wetbulb temperature of air entering the evaporator section.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group - Operational Faults -> text
input: What does the Field: Thermostat Name define?
output: The Field: Thermostat Name defines the name of the thermostat object associated with the fault which should be the name of a ZoneControl:Thermostat object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What is the default value for the availability schedule if the field is blank?
output: If this field is blank the schedule has values of 1 for all time periods.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text
input: What is included in the calculation of the AFN Zone Mixing Volume?
output: The AFN Zone Mixing Volume includes the volume of air flow into the zone from adjacent zones through window/door openings and cracks in the interior heat transfer surfaces of the zone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: How is the effective EIR calculated for a given simulation timestep?
output: The product of the rated EIR and EIR modifier curves is divided by the output of this curve to give the effective EIR for a given simulation timestep.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heat Recovery -> text
input: What is specified in the 'Field: Process Air Outlet Node Name'?
output: The name of the HVAC system node to which the unit sends its process outlet air.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text
input: What is the high temperature difference of the melting curve?
output: The high temperature difference of the melting curve is 23 deltaC.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: Which component inputs are altered by the Sizing Factor?
output: For this component the inputs that would be altered by the sizing factor are: Nominal Capacity Design Chilled Water Flow Rate and Design Condenser Water Flow Rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heat Recovery -> text
input: What type of heat exchanger is used?
output: The heat exchanger type is 'Plate'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text
input: What assumption does the program make if the Number of Cells field is not entered?
output: If not entered the program will assume it is a single-cell cooling tower.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Variable Refrigerant Flow Equipment -> text
input: What does the BiQuadratic curve parameterize for the i-th loading index?
output: It parameterizes the variation of VRF evaporating capacity as a function of operating conditions i.e. evaporating and condensing temperatures.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text
input: How are the fields for AirflowNetwork:MultiZone:Component:DetailedOpening object similar to another object?
output: The fields are similar to those for AirflowNetwork:MultiZone:Surface Crack object when the window or door is closed but additional fields are required to describe the air flow characteristics when the window or door is open.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text
input: What does the Curve:ChillerPartLoadWithLift or Table:Lookup parameterize for the type of Lift?
output: It parameterizes the variation of EIR as a function of the normalized fractional Lift normalized Tdev and the PLR.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Air Distribution -> text
input: What does the 'Zone Mechanical Ventilation Standard Density Volume' variable report?
output: It reports the total outdoor air volume that has been supplied to a zone over the reporting interval calculated using a standard density for air.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: When is the 'Zone Hybrid Unitary HVAC System Sensible Cooling Energy' output positive?
output: The output is positive when sensible heat is removed by the system otherwise it is zero.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Airflow Network -> text
input: What will the possible combination allow EnergyPlus to simulate?
output: The possible combination will allow the EnergyPlus to simulate a thermal zone using a network approach by assuming internal nodes connected by user-defined patterns of temperatures and airflows.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Advanced Surface Concepts -> text
input: What warnings will the program issue regarding surfaces?
output: The program will issue warnings if surfaces have widely ranging tilts and azimuths.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Exterior Energy Use Equipment -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'End-Use Subcategory' field in the Exterior:Lights input?
output: Allows you to specify a user-defined end-use subcategory e.g. 'Grounds Lights' 'Facade Lights' etc.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What does the output variable 'Integrated Heat Pump Air Latent Cooling Energy' represent?
output: The output variable is the total latent cooling output of the integrated heat pump in joules over the timestep being reported.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: Is the 'Speed <x> Reference Unit Rated Condenser Air Flow Rate' field used for an air-cooled condenser?
output: No for an air-cooled condenser this input is not used.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Zone Forced Air Units -> text
input: What is required for every zone served by an HVAC component?
output: Every zone served by an HVAC component must have a return air node even though this node may not be connected to anything.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Detailed Ground Heat Transfer -> text
input: What happens when a Slab or Basement run is performed?
output: When a Slab or Basement run is performed the results are saved in files with extensions .SLAB or .BSMT so that they do not need to be rerun if no input changes are made to the GroundHeatTransfer:Slab or GroundHeatTransfer:Basement objects.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \textbf/ -> text
input: How is the 'Running Mean Outdoor Dry-Bulb Temperature' value used?
output: This value is used to control the constant flow low temperature radiant system when the user opts to use the 'RunningMeanOutdoorDryBulbTemperature' control type.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Setpoint Managers -> text

output: SetpointManager:MultiZone:Humidity:Minimum performs as SetpointManager:SingleZone:Humidity:Minimum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Condenser Equipment -> text

output: UFactorTimesAreaAndDesignWaterFlowRate

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \\textbf/ -> text
input: What does the 'Zone Name' field represent?
output: This field is the name of the zone in which the surface is principally located and intended to affect.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Setpoint Managers -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> listing

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text

output: Enter a value of 0.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Unitary Equipment -> text
input: What does the 'Unitary System DX Coil Speed Level' output variable report?
output: The 'Unitary System DX Coil Speed Level' output variable reports the maximum speed needed when the heat pump operates to meet the sensible load (heating or cooling) in a system timestep.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Electric Load Center-Generator Specifications -> text
input: How does this object model the voltage current and energy losses during each time step?
output: Given the surplus or deficit power from the electrical system and the state of charge from the previous time step this object can model the voltage current and energy losses with charging and discharging during each time step.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text

output: The amount of beam and diffuse solar radiation entering a zone through an exterior window is the sum of the following two variables: Surface Window Transmitted Beam Solar Radiation Rate and Surface Window Transmitted Diffuse Solar Radiation Rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> figure in /UAStudy/EnergyPlus/doc/input-output-reference/media/

output: The figure shows a central heat pump system with three chiller-heaters in heat recovery mode where no heat is exchanged with the ground source loop.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What does the 'Speed <x> COP Function of Water Flow Fraction Curve Name' field specify?
output: This alpha field specifies the name of a quadratic or cubic performance curve object that defines the variation in DX coil heating COP as a function of the ratio of actual water flow rate through the condenser to the rated condenser water flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Setpoint Managers -> listing
input: Provide an example input for a Warmest Setpoint Manager.
output: SetpointManager:Warmest  Supply Air Temperature Manager 1  !- Name  Temperature  !- Control Variable  VAV Sys 1  !- HVAC Air Loop Name  11.2  !- Minimum Setpoint Temperature  16.  !- Maximum Setpoint Temperature  MaximumTemperature  !- Strategy  Supply Air Temp Nodes 1;  !- Setpoint Node or NodeList Name

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: What does the 'Condenser Water Inlet Node Name' field define?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Python Plugins / Python EMS -> text

output: A Python Plugin in EnergyPlus is a user-defined Python class that overrides a premade EnergyPlusPlugin base class.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Node-Branch Management -> text

output: A PipingSystem:Underground:PipeCircuit to be included in this domain indicating that the pipe circuit and all of the underlying pipe segments will be included during mesh development and heat transfer calculations within this domain.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Refrigeration -> text

output: This required field provides the name of the curve object that describes the compressor power as a function of the evaporating and condensing temperatures as specified in ARI 540.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Daylighting -> text

output: The two types of daylighting devices in EnergyPlus are tubular daylighting devices and daylighting shelves.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Design Objects -> text

output: The autosized cold water hot water and steam flow rates in the parent zone HVAC objects and capacity in child components are determined using the scalable sizing methods.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group Heating and Cooling Coils -> text
input: At what point is the performance curve normalized to have a value of 1.0 for the 'Cooling And Discharge Mode Storage Energy Input Ratio Function of Flow Fraction Curve Name' field?
output: The performance curve is normalized to have a value of 1.0 at the rating point defined as x = 1.0.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
input: What is the fraction of exterior diffuse solar radiation transmitted through a screen on an exterior window?
output: For an exterior window with a screen it is the fraction of exterior diffuse solar radiation incident on the screen that is transmitted through the screen as diffuse solar radiation when the screen is isolated.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: None -> text
input: How is the energy rate per unit area for ET determined?
output: The energy rate per unit area for ET is determined by latent heat of vaporization for total ET over time period and surface area.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Simulation Parameters -> text

output: Just remember to set your run period back to a full year before coming to any conclusions about the building or energy efficiency options being considered for the building.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Radiative \textbf/ -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Surface Construction Elements -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Plant Equipment -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Using EnergyPlus as a Library -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: Input-Output Reference -> Section: Group -- Thermal Zone Description/Geometry -> text
